chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive

result.execSummary:
The defendant Emmanuel B Richards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.08(1).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$2,034.00 to be paid as follows:  $1,182.00 to Sheila M. and $852.00 to Thomas F.
*12/13/2017 the amount of $1,182.00 to Sheila M. to be amended to be paid as follows:  $1,060.73 to be paid to Crime Victim Compensation Fund and $121.27 to be paid to Sheila M.

Provide a DNA sample and pay appropriate costs unless previously done and completed.  EACH COUNT:  Pay  DNA surcharge, all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges. 
AS TO RESTITUTUION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:   DOC to collect from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: COUNTS ONE AND TWO, EACH COUNT: are to be served concurrent with each other, and consecutive to revocation sentence being served in 12CF5636.
The defendant is advised:   as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that his voting privleges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (42 pages) commencing MAY 8, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Emmanuel B Richards in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Emmanuel B Richards in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Tramia W., Shelia E., Shelia M., Sharquon W., and Samuel T.
AS to count 1:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS 
AS to count 2:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS with the following conditions, Counts 1 and 2 are to be served concurrent with each other and consecutive to revocation sentence being served in 12CF5636:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Defendant stipulates to restitution in the amount of $2034.00: $1182.00 to Shelia M. and $852.00 to Thomas F.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs unless previously done and completed.
-Pay a DNA surcharge as to each count.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS, ASSESSMENTS SURCHARGES AND RESTITUTION WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant remanded.
Notice of Right to Seek PostConviction Relief signed and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment signed and filed.
Sentencing Memorandum received and filed.
Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Filed by the State:  Offer letter; Victim witness statement and restitution information.

Defendant Emmanuel B Richards in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Emmanuel B Richards in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to negotiations, the REPEATER enhancer is deleted as to both counts.
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
The Court will order a PSI update from PSI completed in 12CF5636, without a recommendation.
Defendant is remanded and case is adjourned to 5-8-2014 at 8:15 for sentencing.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Emmanuel B Richards not in court, in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance is waived.  Counsel is requesting a plea date.  Case adjourned to 4-1-2014 at 8:15a.m. in Branch 38 for GUILTY PLEA. ls
Subpoena

Defendant Emmanuel B Richards in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Emmanuel B Richards in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Timothy Graham-MPD Detective.  
Case is temporarily passed.

Case is recalled on the record.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Danielle L Shelton in court, defendant Emmanuel B Richards not in court, in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to modify NO CONTACT ORDER.  The State has no objection to removing the defendant's mother and brother from the No Contact Order.  The Court orders that Penny Jackson and Marcello Richards be removed from the No Contact Order.  All other conditions of bail to remain the same.
Case is adjourned to 2-20-2014 at 1:30pm for preliminary hearing-date was previously set per counsels.
Notion of Motion and Motion For Review and Modification of Bail

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with (see signed no contact order).

Defendant Emmanuel B Richards in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Emmanuel B Richards in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
